publicationstmt.publisher: Geography and Map Division, Library of Congress

descriptivenote.p: DACS was used as the primary description standard.

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: Finding aid encoded by the Library of Congress Geography and Map Division

did.head: Collection Summary

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English and Spanish.

corpname.part: Geography and Map Division, Library of Congress

did.abstract: The collection consists of seventy-five maps depicting locations in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Europe, and Japan.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Bertha Schooler Sohn donated the materials to the Geography and Map Division in 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The collection was processed and arranged by the Geography and Map Division in 1997.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Materials from the Bertha Schooler Sohn map collection are governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.) and other applicable international copyright laws.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Bertha Schooler Sohn map collection collection is open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Geography and Map Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Bertha Schooler Sohn map collection collection, Geography and Map Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Bertha Schooler Soh was born on August 7, 1915 in New York City and died July 31, 2006.
Sohn was a cataloger with the Smithsonian Institution Libraries, Washington, D.C., from 1963 to 1987.
Thereafter, she worked as a freelance researcher and translator and volunteered in the library of the Adas Israel Congregation, Washington, D.C.
She was a member of the Jewish Genealogical Society of Greater Washington.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of seventy-five maps depicting locations in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Europe, and Japan.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Bertha Schooler Sohn map collection collection is organized in a single series with subseries for each geographic area.

list.item: Series I: Bertha Schooler Sohn map collection

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.
